decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: Site Location Plan; 19/112/B; 19/112/C Rev A 19/112/D; Preliminary Ecological Appraisal Date of Report 12/10/20 (Revised 27/07/21); Bat Emergence And Re-Entry Survey Report 01/06/2021 (Revised 27/07/21); Supporting Document titled "Site Investigation Report" Dated 01/06/2021

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.
REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s) shall be installed in the flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of the development and/or any preparatory works to clear the site, a construction environment management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, this plan shall include details of how the development fully integrates ecological considerations with regards to protected/priority species and habitats and other features of biodiversity interest, within and around the development site during preparatory works, construction and site landscaping.

Reason: For the protection and enhancement of biodiversity in accordance with the NPPF (2021), Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies DM 20 and DM 21 of the DMP (2013).
Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of the development,  details of an Ecological Mitigation and Enhancement Plan (EMEP) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate how the proposals will benefit biodiversity within the adjoining SINC and, in consequence, the wider local ecological network. The plan shall include, but is not limited to:
i.	 details of ecological mitigation and enhancement - a detailed assessment, incorporating a Metric 3.0 evaluation, of the current value of the site and of the proposals for its enhancement for the benefit of semi-natural habitats, protected and priority species and other semi-natural or artificial features;
ii.	Set out in detail the measures to be undertaken to successfully establish, and thereafter retain and manage these features in target state thereafter, for a period of at least 30 years following establishment;
iii.	Show how any potential direct or indirect impacts of the development, e.g. from external lighting, on features of biodiversity interest within and around the development site will be avoided or kept within acceptable levels;
iv.	Details of timing (during the establishment phase and thereafter), implementation, management and maintenance

Reason: For the protection and enhancement of biodiversity in accordance with the NPPF (2021), Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies DM 20 and DM 21 of the DMP (2013)
description: Single storey front infill extension; two storey side extension; rear dormer (demolition of side extension)
